alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 3:29PM EDT until June 11 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Lee County in central South Carolina... South central Chesterfield County in central South Carolina... Southeastern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 327 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Goodale State Park, or 7 miles northeast of Camden, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm has a history of knocking down large trees. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Cassatt, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Goodale State Park, Mcbee, Bethune, Lucknow, Alligator Fire Station, Middendorf, Woodward Airfield, Antioch, Ashland and Midway Elementary School. This includes Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 101 and 107. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways or walk through high water.
